pullRequest.title: Fix type mismatch between return datatype of getter and argumet datatype of setter
pullRequest.bodyText:
Fix datatype for authentication attributes to let property utils to find appropriate write method
Fixes #1056

commit.message: Fix type mismatch between return datatype of getter and argumet datatype of setter

nodes.bodyText:
All you had to do was rename the method, the logic could have stayed where it was.
The idea of enums is that once (in the near future?) we can add them to our xsd so people can use autocomplete to fill the attribute values.
There isn't really a standard yet, but I think we should use getMethodNameEnum() so in this case getAuthenticationMethodEnum. Since there is no need to have a getter, and we don't want the 'BeansParser' to error when the dataTypes are different, just renaming the method should be enough.
If a getter is desirable, the getter-method should call the getMethodNameEnum().name() method, which in turn returns the correct dataType.
I'm confused, shouldn't this test return an exception?

commit.message:
Revert "Fix type mismatch between return datatype of getter and argumet datatype of setter"

This reverts commit 3c2e3c0264215f20ac6ae64b5049f57d33ec9f2f.
